@description.name: @description
@description.body: Border implementation with two CSS borders. Both borders can be styled independent of each other. This mixin is usually used by {@link qx.ui.decoration.Decorator}.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: top width of border

@description.name: @description
@description.body: right width of border

@description.name: @description
@description.body: bottom width of border

@description.name: @description
@description.body: left width of border

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Property group to set the inner border width of all sides

@description.body: top inner color of border

@description.body: right inner color of border

@description.name: @description
@description.body: bottom inner color of border

@description.name: @description
@description.body: left inner color of border

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Property group for the inner color properties.

@description.body: The opacity of the inner border.

@description.body: Property group to configure the top border

@description.body: Property group to configure the bottom border

@description.body: Property group to set the border width of all sides

@description.name: @description
@description.body: The URL of the background image

@description.name: @description
@description.body: How the background image should be repeated

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Either a string or a number, which defines the horizontal position of the background image. If the value is an integer it is interpreted as a pixel value, otherwise the value is taken to be a CSS value. For CSS, the values are "center", "left" and "right".

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Either a string or a number, which defines the vertical position of the background image. If the value is an integer it is interpreted as a pixel value, otherwise the value is taken to be a CSS value. For CSS, the values are "top", "center" and "bottom".

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Specifies where the background image is positioned.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Property group to define the background position

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Whether to order gradients before Image-URL-based background declarations if both qx.ui.decoration.MBackgroundImage and qx.ui.decoration.MLinearBackgroundGradient decorations are used.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Takes a styles map and adds the outer border styles in place to the given map. This is the needed behavior for {@link qx.ui.decoration.Decorator}.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: styles {Map} A map to add the styles.
@param.description: A map to add the styles.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Converts the inner border's colors to rgba.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: innerColor {Map} map of top, right, bottom and left colors
@param.description: map of top, right, bottom and left colors

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Implementation of the interface for the double border.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Takes a styles map and adds the border styles styles in place to the given map. This is the needed behavior for {@link qx.ui.decoration.Decorator}.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: styles {Map} A map to add the styles.
@param.description: A map to add the styles.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Implementation of the interface for the single border.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Gets the (computed) value of the property widthTop. For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #widthTop}.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Sets the user value of the property widthTop. For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #widthTop}.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Resets the user value of the property widthTop. The computed value falls back to the next available value e.g. appearance, init or inheritance value depending on the property configuration and value availability. For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #widthTop}.
